text.0: Workers digging a garage for a new hotel took a groundbreaking step in the development of the local community. The local authorities and businesses were excited to see the progress of the construction of the new hotel, and they were eager to ensure it would be a success. The garage will be located underground and will provide a convenient alternative to parking at the hotel. This development will not only reduce the strain on parking facilities and improve the quality of life for residents. The
text.1: Workers digging an underground garage for a new hotel  recently struck something big about 30 feet below the surface. This week they uncovered it - a boulder that's thousands of years old and bigger than an SUV, weighing an estimated 150 tons or 300,000lbs. A geotechnical engineer who was called out to examine the giant rock in Everett, Washington. The rock, which weighs 150 tons and is bigger than an SUV was discovered in Everett, Washington.
